revised_title: Observations of Stars' Positions and Parallax Using Equatorial Telescope
tldr: Lord Wrottesley conducted observations of 19 stars using an equatorial telescope to study their positions and parallax. The observations were challenging due to limited time and unfavorable conditions. The results showed that only a few stars exhibited measurable parallax, and the author recommended two stars, 32 Eridani and Herschel 95, for further observation by other astronomers.
